user_request: View the shopping cart on amazon. Search for razer nari on amazon, select the first entry, and add it to the cart.
screen_desc: This screenshot shows a web browser with a search bar at the top and a list of recently visited or suggested websites. The top entry is a Target product page for Duracell Triple A batteries, followed by links to Amazon, eBay, Costco, and Newegg. Each entry includes the website name, a brief description, and a clickable link. Some entries have a refresh icon, while others have an external link icon. The bottom of the screen displays navigation buttons, including back, home, and recent apps.
history_actions: click on the Amazon app icon located at the right lower part of the screen.
click on the located at the top.

Since the browser currently displays a list of recently visited sites, and the user has clicked the Amazon link previously, I will now need to navigate within Amazon to access the shopping cart and proceed with the search and add-to-cart process.
